snippet: Gunmen attacked Karachi’s airport on Tuesday for the second time this week, and the death toll from the first attack rose to at least 36 as seven additional bodies were found.
abstract: Pakistani Taliban attack security forces at Karachi's international airport for second time in two days; no casualties are reported; Taliban spokesman, who claimed responsibility for the attack, calls it retaliation for Pakistani military airstrikes in northwestern mountains earlier that day.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and SALMAN MASOOD
byline.contributor: Declan Walsh reported from London, and Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan. Zia ur-Rehman contributed reporting from Karachi, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: Gunmen attacked Karachi’s airport on Tuesday for the second time this week, and the death toll from the first attack rose to at least 36 as seven additional bodies were found.

headline.main: Taliban Hit Airport Again After Pakistani Airstrikes
headline.print_headline: Taliban Hit Airport Again After Pakistani Airstrikes
